document.masterDocTitle: Revision of the Oriental Chaetocnema species (Coleoptera, Chrysomelidae, Galerucinae, Alticini)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Revision of the Oriental Chaetocnema species (Coleoptera, Chrysomelidae, Galerucinae, Alticini)

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Chaetocnema psylloides
Pic, 1909: 139
. TL: Uzbekistan , “Buchara”. TD: MNHN. Lectotype designated by
Konstantinov, 2011: 276

Chaetocnema altisocia
Chen & Wang, 1981: 493
. TL: China , Tibet . TD: IZCAS. Synonymized by
Konstantinov, 2011: 276

subSubSection.paragraph:
Description: Description is not provided here, as this species has been revised by
Konstantinov et al. (2011)
.

FIGURE 106.
Chaetocnema psylloides

Male habitus. B Pronotum. C Head, frontal view. D Aedeagus, ventral view. E Aedeagus, lateral view. F Apex of aedeagus, ventral view. G Elytra, peri-scutellar area.

Remarks: Type specimens of
Chaetocnema altisocia
were collected from Tibet at an elevation of 4500 m ; however, some other specimens are collected from Hissar ( India ) with an elevation of about
200 m .
It indicates that this species can survive not only in freezing and arid environment with extreme high altitude, but also warm and lowland with humid subtropical climate.
